entry.title: Combined summary - Ordinals BIP PR
entry.summary:
The email received discusses the decision not to request a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) for OpenTimestamps. The sender argues that BIP assignment should be limited to widely-used standards that serve the core mission of Bitcoin, and that documenting every protocol with a BIP is unnecessary. They mention Lightning as an example of a widely-used technology that has its own separate process. The sender suggests that BIP assignment should be reserved for protocols of significant importance to the Bitcoin community.
Another email discusses the sender's disagreement with the recipient's BIP, considering it to be a regression rather than an improvement. They urge the recipient to retract their proposal or consider alternative proposals that do not negatively affect the chain. The sender emphasizes the importance of focusing on real BIPs that actually improve Bitcoin.
A different email addresses the evaluation of BIPs based on implementation and consequences for the network. The writer argues against this approach, stating that it sets a bad precedent and makes it difficult to interact with the BIPs repository. They emphasize that the BIPs repository does not represent the entire consensus within the community and caution against interpreting BIP numbers as an indication of endorsement by a specific influential group.
Lastly, an email requests clarification and feedback regarding the Ordinals BIP PR. The sender expresses frustration over the lack of communication from the BIP editors and explains that BIPs are technical documentation that do not guarantee inclusion in any implementation or consensus. They seek feedback on whether the ordinals BIP is suitable and ask for guidance on necessary changes for acceptance. The email highlights the importance of receiving feedback and guidance on the next steps for the BIP.
